meanings.sent1: I have only one apple left in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She picked up one book from the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to bring one pencil each.
meanings.sent4: The lonely tree stood as the only one in the field.
meanings.sent5: The detective found only one clue at the crime scene.

meanings.sent1: He found a single coin on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The child held a single balloon in her hand.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a single cherry on top of the cake.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a single window overlooking the garden.
meanings.sent5: The explorer discovered a single footprint in the sand.

meanings.definition: A suffix meaning 'related to' or 'derived from'
meanings.sent3: The term 'Humane' includes the 'ane' suffix for compassion.
meanings.sent4: The scientist explained that 'Ultramarine' has 'ane' indicating beyond the sea.
meanings.sent5: The artist used 'Cubane' in the painting, showing its geometric nature.
